video_identification.title: Tour of Umm Al-Hiran, Months after the village was demolished

extracted_metadata.title: Tour of Umm Al-Hiran, Months after the village was demolished
extracted_metadata.description: In November, Israeli authorities demolished the entire Bedouin village of Umm Al-Hiran to make way for a new Orthodox Jewish settlement named Dror‚Äîmeaning ‚Äúfreedom‚Äù in Hebrew. This came despite the community‚Äôs years-long efforts to negotiate with the government to remain on their land and live side by side with the new Jewish residents. Their pleas were ignored. They were treated with contempt throughout. Now, reports have surfaced that subsidized plots in Dror were awarded to settlers‚Äîincluding the son of far-right minister Bezalel Smotrich‚Äîexposing the corruption and racism at the heart of this project. The state not only broke its promises to Umm Al-Hiran‚Äôs residents but continues to systematically dispossess its own citizens for political and ideological gain. Where is our Jewish morality? We cannot go on like this. üìç In the video: Rahat council member and deputy mayor Dr. Mazen Abu Siam, Farhan Abu Riash from the Hura local council, MK Naama Lazimi, and Avi Dabush, director of Rabbis for Human Rights. Mosque destruction video credit - @972mag
